Now, please provide me with the Event you have in mind, and I will generate an IAS attribution social media post based on that event.

Transferred_Post:
"Summer school, here I come! 😔 Looks like I've got some catching up to do on those pesky units. Guess it's back to the grindstone for me 💪🏼 #summerschool #catchingup #unitcompletion"

Explanation:
The original post attributes the cause of having to attend summer school to the individual's own actions or abilities ("I've got some catching up to do"). This is an internal attributional style. To transfer this post to an external attributional style, we can attribute the cause to something external, such as the difficulty of the course ("those pesky units") or the educational system ("summer school"). The transferred post still conveys the same information but with a different attributional style.
